oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Single-photon orbital angular momentum qudit states in fiber - Limits to Dephasing correction via dynamical decoupling
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gupta, Manish K.
Dowling, Jonathan P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Quantum Physics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We analytically derive a decoherence model for orbital angular momentum states of a photon in a multimode optical fiber and show that rate of decoherence scales exponentially with $l^2$, where $l$ is the azimuthal mode order.~We also show numerically that for large values of $l$ the orbital angular momentum photon state completely dephases.~However for lower values of $l$ the decoherence can be minimized by using dynamical decoupling to allow for qudit high-bandwidth quantum communication and similar applications. \end{abstract}
